comment: very caring professor one of the best at KSU. straight forward and lets you know how it is. made me want to study viruses more.

Dr. Haddow is an interesting guy. Sometimes I questioned his sanity, but that's what makes a science professor good. Attendance technically isn't required but he tracks it. Has in-class review sessions for exams and lots of extra credit opportunities. Does not allow recording or anything. Read the textbook and show up to lecture, you'll do well

Haddow is the BEST you will get. The class was pretty easy for a 4k bio class but I learned so much. Gives a TON of extra credit and will tell you in class what questions will be on the exam. You are usually expected to read the textbook before lecture. His lectures consist of him telling you exactly what slides you should know. TAKE HIM!

Truly the best professor at KSU, actually cares about his students beyond grades and wants you to succeed. Memorization is very important and you definitely should come to class cause that's when he tells you what you need to know. Overall, the material is a lot but he makes it very interesting and is very clear on what he wants
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had him his first semester teaching. We had quizzes every day over the previous material which also included questions over textbook readings. Lectures & exams were heavy, so good memoization needed. Prepare to learn life cycles and correct spelling of species. Said next classes won't be as easy as his first. Helped build our critical thinking.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Haddow was new to teaching this semester, and he was a good professor . He wants you to know the information well, so studying is super important. I dont know if the class will be the same in the future, but if you do the readings and study quizzes, youll be okay. Hes also understanding that life happens, but hes really big on cheating.

Professor Haddow is new to KSU as of Fall 2021. Because of that, he did some things a little differently for a high level Biology course. There are quizzes every class and the tests are based off of the quizzes, however they do get harder as time goes on. No tests dropped or replaced. Hes a really nice guy and is understanding for most situations

when i took him, he was new to the university. you have a quiz every class period. his exams are very heavy  with information and can be tough but if you study, you will get a good grade. he has really cool stories and cares about his students. he basically tells you what to study. the exams and quizzes come straight from the lecture. 10/10

this class was not that difficult but if you don't study the life cycles thoroughly and memorize them verbatim, then it will be very difficult to pass the exams. quizzes started off easy and progressively got difficult and same could be said with the exams but majority of the exam questions come from the quizzes. A LOT OF EXTRA CREDIT OPPURTUNITIES

His class is very intense. He wants you to know the information really well. Lots of quizzes but the quiz questions make up a good chunk of the test. He's super generous. He tells you exactly what to study and he gives a lot of extra credit. He really wants his students to succeed and wants to help them. Not an easy A, but an amazing professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT
